<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>We heard that today is the 20th anniversary of the release of the movie <em>Fight Club</em>...but that could also be our alter egos talking. Two decades later, it remains one of Hollywood’s most famous critiques of consumer culture, with musings like... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The things you own end up owning you.” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"We've all been raised on television to believe that one day we'd all be millionaires, and movie gods, and rock stars, but we won't."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s your take on the film? Underrated? Overrated? Properly rated?</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
#METOO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/14/nbc-news-goes-defense-vs-ronan-farrow?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NBC News Goes on Defense
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NBC News Goes on Defense" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMDg3MDA4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, investigative reporter Ronan Farrow releases his new book, <em>Catch and Kill</em>. It claims that top brass at NBC News orchestrated a coverup to mask alleged sexual misconduct by ex-<em>Today</em> host Matt Lauer.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">NBC won’t be making the trip to Barnes & Noble</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a memo to staff yesterday, NBC News President Noah Oppenheim said, “Farrow’s effort to defame NBC News is clearly motivated not by a pursuit of truth, but an <a href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/nbc-news-chief-noah-oppenheim-unleashes-on-ronan-farrow-in-new-staff-memo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">axe to grind</a>. It is built on a series of distortions, confused timelines, and outright inaccuracies.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In Farrow's book, former NBC News employee Brooke Nevils claims Lauer raped her at the 2014 Sochi Olympics. After Nevils filed a complaint against Lauer, Farrow writes, Oppenheim and NBC News Chairman Andy Lack said the incident wasn’t criminal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>Catch and Kill </em></span><span>recounts </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-14/nbc-pushes-back-against-farrow-book-s-claims-on-lauer-handling?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seven allegations</a></span><span> of misconduct by Lauer before he was fired.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>NBC says its legal team found three instances, all of which involved employees who “by their own admissions made no complaint to management.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s more: </strong>Farrow alleges NBC News <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/10/11/769326096/ronan-farrow-stands-by-his-reporting-on-nbc-s-corrosive-secrecy-around-sexual-ab?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried to squash</a> his reporting on alleged sexual predator Harvey Weinstein in 2017...when Farrow was employed by NBC News. He then took the story to The New Yorker, where he won a Pulitzer Prize for his reporting on Weinstein.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NBC also rebuts this:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Not only is this false, the so-called evidence Farrow uses in his book to support the charge collapses under the </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/14/business/media/nbc-news-ronan-farrow-matt-lauer-catch-and-kill.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slightest scrutiny</a></span><span>,” Oppenheim said. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Farrow replied that the book is an “</span><span><span>extraordinarily meticulously fact-checked work of investigative journalism." </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>NBC execs are going to war against a <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ronan-farrow-nbc-journalists-anguished-at-lies-executives-1247384?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pulitzer winner</a> known for high-stakes investigative pieces on some of the most powerful men in the business world, including <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2018/08/06/les-moonves-and-cbs-face-allegations-of-sexual-misconduct?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ex-CBS chief Les Moonves</a>. In doing so, they’re putting their reputations, and their relationships with the NBC rank-and-file, on the line.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/14/nobel-prize-economics-awarded-one-highachieving-trio?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Best Economists Come in Threes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjU2L2Q0MTU4Ni0wMTktMDMxMjUteV8xNzI2ODc2MF9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Niklas Elmehed / Nobel Media</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Abhijit Banerjee, Esther Duflo, and Michael Kremer were <a href="https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2019/summary/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">awarded</a> the Nobel Prize in economics yesterday for their <a href="https://www.nobelprize.org/uploads/2019/10/popular-economicsciencesprize2019-2.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">innovative research</a> into alleviating global poverty. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A few interesting facts: </strong>Duflo is the youngest person and the second woman to win the economics prize. Banerjee and Duflo are married. +1 for Cambridge, MA, where all three winners are professors (Duflo and Banerjee at MIT, Kremer at Harvard).</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What the trio has taught us about the world</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A few years ago, Banerjee, Duflo, and co-authors published </span><span><a href="https://economics.mit.edu/files/5993?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pioneering work</a></span><span> on microcredit programs in India. Turns out, these really small loans help somewhat but aren’t a game-changer for poverty. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a 2000 paper called “</span><span><a href="https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/aer.90.1.212&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elephants</a></span><span>,” Kremer and Charles Morcom took on elephant poaching. They argued that in some circumstances, governments should actually stockpile ivory...then threaten to sell it and flood the market if the elephant population drops too low. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Kremer also looked at </span><span><a href="https://pubs.aeaweb.org/doi/pdfplus/10.1257/jep.22.3.189?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">peer effects</a></span><span> in college roommates. The conclusion: Males randomly selected to live with roommates who drank alcohol before college earned lower GPAs. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Congrats to all three for your inspiring work.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/14/johnson-johnson-reports-earnings-amid-100000-lawsuits?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Johnson & Johnson Lawyers Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjU4LzEyODBweC1qb2huc29uc19iYWJ5X3Bvd2Rlcl9tYXNzYWdlX2pwZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Austin Kirk, Johnsons Baby Powder massage, CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Healthcare behemoth Johnson & Johnson (-0.46%) <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/earnings-preview-johnson-johnson-jnj-143002879.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports Q3 earnings</a> this morning. It might be hard to hear CFO Joseph Wolk over the sound of about 100,000 lawsuits the company’s facing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most recently, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/09/uk/johnson-and-johnson-male-breast-growth-damages/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a jury ordered</a> J&J to pay $8 billion last week for allegedly <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-johnson-johnson-risperdal-verdict/jj-must-pay-8-billion-in-case-over-male-breast-growth-linked-to-risperdal-jury-idUSKBN1WN2HK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mishandling</a> an anti-psychotic drug called Risperdal. There are <span>over</span> <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-08/j-j-unit-ordered-to-pay-8-billion-over-anti-psychotic-drug?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13,000</a> more Risperdal suits waiting in the wings, plus...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plaintiffs are seeking compensation for injuries allegedly caused by </span><span><a href="https://www.insurancejournal.com/news/national/2019/10/14/545364.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">other products</a></span><span>, including a diabetes drug, a mesh pelvic device for women, and a talcum powder.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Settling litigation over J&J’s marketing of opioid drugs </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/johnson-johnsons-legal-challenges-mount-11571055242?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could cost it</a></span><span> $5–$10 billion, per Wells Fargo analysts. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">J&J’s strategy? </strong>Pedal to the floor. The WSJ says the company has been taking many cases to trial rather than settling. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Investors have noticed.</strong> J&J’s stock is down about 12% from its recent high. During the same time, the S&P has gained 12% and the index's healthcare sector is down 2%. As for today’s earnings, analysts anticipate year-over-year decreases on the top and bottom lines.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ROUNDUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/14/unicorns-not-good-monday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Unicorn Problems
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Unicorn Problems" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMDg2MjcwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Poke your horn through the windshield on your way to work? Could be worse—you could be these past and present unicorns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">At WeWork...</strong>executives haven’t been this busy since the fruit water shortage of ’17. First, they’re reportedly <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/14/business/dealbook/wework-bailout-softbank-jpmorgan.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">weighing</a> two separate but equally ginormous financial bailout plans to keep the lights on.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>SoftBank (WeWork’s biggest shareholder) is </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbank-seeking-to-take-control-of-wework-through-financing-package-11571002488?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">floating</a></span><span> a debt and equity investment that would give it control of the startup.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan is suggesting a multibillion-dollar debt financing package now that a WeWork IPO is off the calendar.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, WeWork yesterday let members in the U.S. and Canada know it’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-14/wework-phone-booths-to-be-removed-due-to-formaldehyde?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">removing 2,300</a> phone booths from some of its locations because they might contain <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/14/wework-pulls-thousands-of-phone-booths-out-of-service-over-formaldehyde-scare/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">elevated levels</a> of formaldehyde. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">At SmileDirectClub...</strong>shares <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/smiledirectclub-stock-slides-10-as-california-gov-newsom-signs-law-to-change-teledentistry-rules-2019-10-14?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tanked</a> almost 13% yesterday after CA Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill changing regulations for “teledentistry.” With shares down <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/14/smiledirectclub-tanks-on-california-bill-bringing-loss-since-september-ipo-to-nearly-60percent.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 60%</a> since its public offering, SDC is the worst-performing big IPO this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">At Uber...</strong>CEO Dara Khosrowshahi <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/14/uber-lays-off-about-350-employees-in-self-driving-eats-and-other-divisions.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> ~350 layoffs (about 1.5% of Uber’s workforce) across several teams. Since July, Uber's (+3.29%) cut <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/14/technology/uber-layoffs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over 1,000</a> jobs.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/14/business-casual-episode-4-amazon-office-space?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
<em>Business Casual </em>Episode 4: The Amazon of Office Space
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="<em>Business Casual </em>Episode 4: The Amazon of Office Space" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMDkxNTgzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While MySpace was busy ruining friendships in the early aughts, Facebook was readying to upend life as we know it. <a href="https://www.knotel.com/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=native&campaign=podcastpromo&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Knotel</a> CEO Amol Sarva thinks his flexible workspace platform is the Facebook to WeWork’s MySpace.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast <em>Business Casual</em>, we get into the nitty gritty of flexible office space and the future of work. Sarva isn’t afraid to name names...and cast doubt on WeWork’s financials.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More highlights from the conversation:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sarva explains the difficulties of cauterizing “ethical rot” vs. “financial rot.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He makes a case for celebrating the coming recession. Sarva argues that although real estate can be capital intensive, flexible workspace will thrive when things go south.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For anyone looking to optimize your life—Sarva’s point about why we don’t build our own iPhones is for you.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When he’s not plotting to out-Zuckerberg WeWork, Sarva 1) got his PhD in cognitive science at Stanford 2) co-founded Virgin Mobile USA and 3) uses both “Faustian” and “schadenfreude” in the interview...so you know you’re going to learn something.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the episode here:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/knotel?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/knotelspotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/knotelluminary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Luminary</a></p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxMDg3MDA4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, investigative reporter Ronan Farrow releases his new book, \u003cem\u003eCatch and Kill\u003c/em\u003e. It claims that top brass at NBC News orchestrated a coverup to mask alleged sexual misconduct by ex-\u003cem\u003eToday\u003c/em\u003e host Matt Lauer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNBC won’t be making the trip to Barnes \u0026 Noble\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a memo to staff yesterday, NBC News President Noah Oppenheim said, “Farrow’s effort to defame NBC News is clearly motivated not by a pursuit of truth, but an \u003ca href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/nbc-news-chief-noah-oppenheim-unleashes-on-ronan-farrow-in-new-staff-memo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaxe to grind\u003c/a\u003e. It is built on a series of distortions, confused timelines, and outright inaccuracies.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn Farrow's book, former NBC News employee Brooke Nevils claims Lauer raped her at the 2014 Sochi Olympics. After Nevils filed a complaint against Lauer, Farrow writes, Oppenheim and NBC News Chairman Andy Lack said the incident wasn’t criminal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCatch and Kill \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003erecounts \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-14/nbc-pushes-back-against-farrow-book-s-claims-on-lauer-handling?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseven allegations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of misconduct by Lauer before he was fired.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNBC says its legal team found three instances, all of which involved employees who “by their own admissions made no complaint to management.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s more: \u003c/strong\u003eFarrow alleges NBC News \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/10/11/769326096/ronan-farrow-stands-by-his-reporting-on-nbc-s-corrosive-secrecy-around-sexual-ab?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried to squash\u003c/a\u003e his reporting on alleged sexual predator Harvey Weinstein in 2017...when Farrow was employed by NBC News. He then took the story to The New Yorker, where he won a Pulitzer Prize for his reporting on Weinstein.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNBC also rebuts this:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“Not only is this false, the so-called evidence Farrow uses in his book to support the charge collapses under the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/14/business/media/nbc-news-ronan-farrow-matt-lauer-catch-and-kill.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslightest scrutiny\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” Oppenheim said. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFarrow replied that the book is an “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eextraordinarily meticulously fact-checked work of investigative journalism.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eNBC execs are going to war against a \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ronan-farrow-nbc-journalists-anguished-at-lies-executives-1247384?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePulitzer winner\u003c/a\u003e known for high-stakes investigative pieces on some of the most powerful men in the business style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNiklas Elmehed / Nobel Media\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAbhijit Banerjee, Esther Duflo, and Michael Kremer were \u003ca href=\"https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2019/summary/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eawarded\u003c/a\u003e the Nobel Prize in economics yesterday for their \u003ca href=\"https://www.nobelprize.org/uploads/2019/10/popular-economicsciencesprize2019-2.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einnovative research\u003c/a\u003e into alleviating global poverty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA few interesting facts: \u003c/strong\u003eDuflo is the youngest person and the second woman to win the economics prize. Banerjee and Duflo are married. +1 for Cambridge, MA, where all three winners are professors (Duflo and Banerjee at MIT, Kremer at Harvard).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat the trio has taught us about the world\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA few years ago, Banerjee, Duflo, and co-authors published \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://economics.mit.edu/files/5993?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epioneering work\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on microcredit programs in India. Turns out, these really small loans help somewhat but aren’t a game-changer for poverty. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a 2000 paper called “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/aer.90.1.212\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eElephants\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” Kremer and Charles Morcom took on elephant poaching. They argued that in some circumstances, governments should actually stockpile ivory...then threaten to sell it and flood the market if the elephant population drops too low. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eKremer also looked at \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://pubs.aeaweb.org/doi/pdfplus/10.1257/jep.22.3.189?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epeer effects\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in college roommates. The conclusion: Males randomly selected to live with roommates who drank alcohol before college earned lower GPAs. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCongrats to all three for your inspiring work.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" It might be hard to hear CFO Joseph Wolk over the sound of about 100,000 lawsuits the company’s facing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost recently, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/09/uk/johnson-and-johnson-male-breast-growth-damages/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea jury ordered\u003c/a\u003e J\u0026J to pay $8 billion last week for allegedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-johnson-johnson-risperdal-verdict/jj-must-pay-8-billion-in-case-over-male-breast-growth-linked-to-risperdal-jury-idUSKBN1WN2HK?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emishandling\u003c/a\u003e an anti-psychotic drug called Risperdal. The WSJ says the company has been taking many cases to trial rather than settling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInvestors have noticed.\u003c/strong\u003e J\u0026J’s stock is down about 12% from its recent high.
